text:
Liz Fraser (born Elizabeth Joan Winch; 14 August 1930 – 6 September 2018) was an English actress. She was best known for her comedy roles as a provocative "dumb blonde" in British movies of the 1950s, 1960s and 1970s. She was born in London.
Fraser was known for her roles in "I'm All Right, Jack", "Carry On Regardless", and in "Dad's Army".
Fraser died at a London hospital from complications of cancer-related surgery on 6 September 2018 at the age of 88.
